meanings.definition: The act of refusing to accept or consider something.
meanings.sent1: Her rejection of the offer was clear and final.
meanings.sent2: The rejection of his job application was disappointing.
meanings.sent3: The rejection of the burnt toast by the hungry dog was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The rejection of her manuscript felt like a door slamming shut.
meanings.sent5: The rejection of his apology echoed in the empty room.

meanings.definition: The feeling of being unwanted or unloved.
meanings.sent1: His heart ached from the rejection he felt after the breakup.
meanings.sent2: The rejection she experienced left a deep emotional scar.
meanings.sent3: The rejection of the last slice of cake made him feel unloved.
meanings.sent4: The rejection of her friendship was like a cold wind on a winter day.
meanings.sent5: The rejection of his affection pierced her like a sharp thorn.

meanings.definition: The dismissal or denial of a proposal or idea.
meanings.sent1: The rejection of the new project surprised everyone in the team.
meanings.sent2: His rejection of her suggestion was met with silence.
meanings.sent3: The rejection of the plan seemed like a missed opportunity.
meanings.sent4: The rejection of his theory left him feeling defeated.
meanings.sent5: The rejection of the innovative idea was met with skepticism.
